workflow.name: Send AI-curated weekly news digests with RSS, Vector DB & GPT-4o
workflow.description:
## What this workflow does

This workflow implements a two-stage news automation system
designed for reusable and topic-driven email delivery.
News articles are continuously collected from multiple platforms
using RSS feeds and stored in a vector database with semantic
embeddings and category metadata.

Instead of fetching news on demand, the workflow separates
daily ingestion from weekly delivery. This allows the same
news data to be reused across different topics, audiences,
or delivery schedules.

On a weekly basis, relevant articles are retrieved from the
vector store based on defined areas of interest and item limits.
The selected news is then processed by an AI agent, which
converts the raw articles into a structured, email-ready format
before sending the final content to users.

## How it works

1. News articles are collected daily from multiple RSS feeds
2. Articles are categorized and stored in a vector database
3. On a weekly trigger, topic preferences are evaluated
4. Relevant articles are retrieved using vector-based search
5. An AI agent formats the content for email delivery
6. The email is sent to the user

## Setup

To use this workflow, complete the following steps:

1. Add and configure your RSS feed sources
2. Connect a vector database and embedding model
3. Configure AI model credentials for content generation
4. Set up email service credentials
5. Define weekly scheduling and topic inputs
6. Test retrieval and email output

## Customization

You can customize this workflow by:

- Adding or removing RSS feed sources
- Adjusting news categories or topic filters
- Changing the number of articles retrieved per topic
- Modifying the AI agent‚Äôs writing tone or structure
- Reusing the vector store for other content workflows
- Updating email frequency or delivery format

## Requirements

- RSS feed URLs
- Vector database credentials
- AI model credentials
- Email service credentials

parameters.text: =Summarize the most relevant tech news published in the past 7 days. Today is {{ $now }}

options.systemMessage:
=Write in clear, concise, and easy-to-understand English, as if curating a weekly tech newsletter.

Prioritize stories related to the following topics: {{ $json.Interests }}.
If those topics aren't present, choose the most impactful, widely reported, and noteworthy tech events from the week.

For each news item:

Provide a short, informative summary (1‚Äì3 sentences max)

Include the article title and a direct link to the original source

Avoid duplicate stories.

Include exactly {{ $json['Number of news items to include'] }} distinct news items.
Maintain a tone that's friendly yet professional, suitable for a broad audience of tech enthusiasts.

nodes.name: Convert Response to an Email-Friendly Format

assignments.name: Number of news items to include

parameters.toolDescription: Call this tool to get the latest news articles.

parameters.content:
## Daily News Collection (RSS)
News is scraped daily from multiple platforms
using their RSS feeds.
Each article is cleaned, categorized,
and prepared for vector storage.

## Vector Store Storage
All news articles are stored in a vector database
with embeddings and category information.
This enables fast and relevant topic-based searches.

## Weekly Trigger & User Preferences

On a weekly basis, this workflow runs to prepare news emails.
User preferences include:
‚Ä¢ Area of interest (topics)
‚Ä¢ Number of news items
‚Ä¢ Email address

## How it works

This workflow sends weekly topic-based news emails using an AI agent.
News articles are first collected daily from multiple platforms via RSS feeds
and stored in a vector database with category and embedding information.

On a weekly schedule, the workflow fetches relevant news from the vector store
based on user-defined interests and the number of articles required.
The selected news is then passed to an AI agent, which converts the raw data
into a clean, readable email format. Finally, the generated content is sent
to the user via email.

The separation between daily ingestion and weekly delivery ensures
efficient processing, better performance, and reusable news data.

## Setup steps

1. Add your RSS feed URLs in the RSS Feed nodes
2. Configure vector database credentials
3. Add your AI model credentials for the agent
4. Configure email service credentials
5. Adjust the weekly schedule if needed
6. Customize the AI prompt or email format as required

main.node: Convert Response to an Email-Friendly Format
